title: The real most valuable players on every NFL team: Who would return multiple first-round picks via trade?
content: This exhaustive NFL trade guide factors in ability, positional value, contracts and age to figure out which players are really worth a first-round pick.

title: Five trades that make too much sense: Which teams should make a deal now?
content: As teams look to finalize their rosters, Seth Walder proposes trades that could help all sides involved.

title: Sources: Kuminga still declining Warriors' terms
content: Jonathan Kuminga's decision to continue to decline the Warriors' offer is due in large part to Golden State's insistence on having a team option for the second season and unwillingness to let him maintain the built-in no-trade clause, sources told ESPN.

title: With Judge out, Yankees trade for OF Slater
content: The Yankees have acquired outfielder Austin Slater from the White Sox, as New York continues to bolster a roster currently without superstar outfielder Aaron Judge.

title: QB Ward: Titans offense is 'very mid right now'
content: The Titans offense, which has struggled on back-to-back days, is "very mid right now," according to rookie quarterback Cameron Ward, the first overall pick in April's NFL draft.

title: Tua: I'm not 'too cool' to play preseason games
content: Dolphins QB Tua Tagovailoa said he'd "love" to see extended run during the three-game preseason slate.

title: Marchand breaks Lochte's 200m medley record
content: Léon Marchand broke the world record in the 200-meter individual medley Wednesday at the world championships in Singapore, clocking 1 minute, 52.61 seconds, to surpass the 1:54.00 set in 2011 by Ryan Lochte.

title: Summer of Sophie: Podcast deal for Cunningham
content: Indiana Fever guard Sophie Cunningham continues to cash in on her fame gained as the on-court defender of teammate Caitlin Clark.

title: Ex-WWE boss McMahon cited over 3-car crash
content: Former WWE CEO Vince McMahon is accused of causing a crash on a Connecticut highway that wrecked his Bentley and damaged two other cars.

title: MLB trade deadline updates, rumors: Countdown to biggest deals is on
content: Which contenders will make the biggest splash? Here's what we're hearing as 6 p.m. ET on Thursday approaches.

title: 'They are all counting on me': How Lynx's Collier juggles her many roles
content: Mom, franchise player, union VP, Unrivaled co-founder, MVP front-runner. Napheesa Collier adeptly juggles it all.

title: How Chris Bey's life changed after one routine move went catastrophically wrong
content: After a life-changing spinal cord injury, Chris Bey wasn't expected to walk again. Nine months later, he's not only walking, he is eyeing a return to professional wrestling.

title: 11 college football teams ready to either build on last season or put it behind them
content: FSU has nowhere to go but up, Michigan can get way better and Arizona State is building on its CFP berth. Which other teams are primed for bigger things in 2025?

title: Ranking every prospect dealt before the 2025 MLB trade deadline
content: You know the major leaguers on the move -- but what about the potential stars of tomorrow headed the other way in those deals?

title: Way-Too-Early men's Bracketology: Houston is No. 1, and we'll have a new WAC champ
content: Grand Canyon moved up its timeline to switch from the WAC to the Mountain West, which significantly shifts the bracket dynamics.

title: USWNT newcomers ranked: All 24 players who have debuted under coach Emma Hayes
content: The USWNT roster has undergone sweeping change under coach Emma Hayes. Let's rank the new players by how likely it is they'll represent the U.S. at the next World Cup.

title: Ready to go: Gyökeres unfazed by Arsenal pressure, taking Henry's No. 14
content: Viktor Gyökeres was signed to turn Arsenal into champions, so taking club icon Thierry Henry's No. 14 was always going to be noticed.

title: August urgency will soon end the lull in soccer's summer transfer window
content: The final days of July are the dog days of soccer's summer transfer window, but August will bring a flurry of wheeling and dealing.

title: Power Rankings: Sparks, Valkyries headed in opposite directions
content: Los Angeles rides a win streak (and Cameron Brink's return) up the latest edition, and Golden State struggles.

title: WNBA trades we want to see: Mabrey to Storm, Hines-Allen to Fever
content: Marina Mabrey, Aaliyah Edwards and Myisha Hines-Allen could be on the move before the trade deadline.

title: Pelton's NBA offseason grades: Who aced their summer -- and who got the only 'F'
content: Kevin Pelton hands out offseason grades for each of the NBA's 30 teams. Who passed, and who scraped by?

title: How Ichiro's HOF induction helps tell the story of Japanese baseball
content: On Ichiro Suzuki's induction weekend, a new exhibit in Cooperstown shares his place in the international baseball landscape.

title: 'Just a top-shelf human being': Teammates, opponents remember Ryne Sandberg
content: Beloved on and off the field, Sandberg leaves a lasting legacy in Chicago and throughout the baseball universe.

title: Panic or patience? What to do with Aaron Judge on the IL
content: With Aaron Judge spending time on the IL, what should fantasy managers do without the best hitter in the league?

title: Six late-round 'fliers' who can help you win your league
content: Hitting on a player late in drafts can be a big boost -- to your team and your ego. Here are six "fliers" you need to be considering.

title: Clay's Playbook: A game plan for your draft day
content: Mike Clay goes position by position and lays out a successful approach for 2025 fantasy football drafts.

title: What to know ahead of the Hungarian GP in Budapest
content: Formula 1 heads to Budapest for round 14 of the 2025 season. Find out the stats, session times and predictions for the last race weekend before the summer break.

title: Piastri halts Norris momentum in F1's knife-edge title fight
content: Lando Norris had won three of the past five F1 races, but Oscar Piastri took a clinical win in Belgium.

title: 'The story's not done yet': England celebrate Euro 2025 win with London parade
content: England partied with 65,000 fans (and Burna Boy) outside Buckingham Palace after winning Euro 2025. But they already have one eye on the World Cup.

title: Ohio to Virginia: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 5 quiz
content: Did someone say sports trivia? As "SportsCenter" continues its summer road trip, we're back for our fifth "state check."

title: General Dwivedi reviews security situation in Manipur
content: General Upendra Dwivedi also called on the Governor of Manipur Ajay Kumar Bhalla and discussed matters on security and development

title: No bail for jailed nuns as Chhattisgarh court cites jurisdiction issues
content: Nuns told to move a special court for relief; their bail application said the girls accompanying them had volunteered for nursing training and work, and that charges of conversion are baseless

title: NMC grants conditional renewal, recognition to 22 government medical colleges in Karnataka
content: The colleges have been given four months to comply, but no penalty has been imposed on any of them this year

title: Air India Group tops audit with 19 critical safety breaches; DGCA says ‘entirely normal’
content: With 300 aircraft, Air India also had 74 level 2 findings, while IndiGo with 419 aircraft had 23; DGCA says high number of findings don’t reflect unusual lapse but scale of airline operations

title: Former YSRCP government didn’t pay Andhra Pradesh’s share of crop insurance, says Union Agriculture Minister Chouhan
content: Centre’s crop insurance scheme had to be revamped as some States didn’t cooperate with it, says Chouhan

title: Blocked 1,400 ‘anti-India’ URLs during Operation Sindoor, says Governement
content: The Information & Broadcasting Minister said, “the government found that massive fake news, misinformation and propaganda campaigns were being run, mostly from outside India”

title: Opposition walks out of Rajya Sabha over PM’s absence
content: Several leaders flag U.S. President Donald Trump’s repeated claims on brokering a ceasefire between India and Pakistan

title: Badri Narayan Tiwari appointed Vice-Chancellor of TISS
content: Professor Tiwari, former head of the Govind Ballabh Pant Social Science Institute in Prayagraj, is the first V-C to be appointed by the Ministry of Education under its new regulations

title: Base kitchen serving trains closed down, slapped with fine of ₹1 lakh
content: Large quantities of stale food were seized in May this year from the facility at Kadavanthra in Kochi

title: India, UAE agree to elevate defence ties
content: At a meeting in New Delhi, the two sides agreed to enhance military training cooperation and discussed their respective training requirements

title: No country can ‘direct’ another’s trade rules: RSS’s economic wing on U.S. trade tariff
content: India did not recognise any sanctions from any country, except the ones issued by the United Nations, it said

title: Supreme Court asks Tamil Nadu government to explain its prosecutorial plan for cases involving Senthilbalaji
content: The Supreme Court said that the alleged bribe-givers in the case were actually victims, turning them into the accused would delay the trial

title: Railways to get 17,000 non-AC coaches in next five years, says Vaishnaw
content: Due to higher availability of general coaches, the number of passengers traveling in general and unreserved coaches has increased, the Minister said in a reply in Lok Sabha

title: Tirupati in grip of fear as elephant herd and leopard roam near Tirumala foothills
content: Forest officials urge devotees to move in groups and stay alert; Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan directs intensified patrolling in forest fringe villages

title: Wayanad remembers landslides victims
content: Relief fund set apart for the rehabilitation of survivors will not be diverted for other purposes, says Revenue Minister K. Rajan

title: Pet-friendly rides gain popularity in Bengaluru as more aggregator apps start offering services
content: Animal activists say these services have made it easier to get urgent care for animals during the golden hour

title: RCB stampede: Findings and recommendations in D’Cunha commission report
content: What are the findings and recommendations made by the judicial commission? Where does the State govt’s responsibility lie in all this? How can Bengaluru integrate mass gathering venues into its urban planning? We discuss in this week’s episode of Decode Karnataka.

title: CPI(M) Andhra Pradesh Secretary questions government’s poverty eradication approach
content: V. Srinivasa Rao flags pressure on teachers and staff under P-4 initiative; demands clarity, accountability from Foundation

title: KAT orders fresh selection process for Principals in arts and science colleges
content: A Division Bench comprising judicial member P.V. Asha and administrative member P.K. Kesavan, in its judgement delivered on Tuesday, directs that fresh appointments must be made from a list of 110 eligible candidates in 2022 in strict adherence to UGC guidelines

title: Around 489 road projects face delays over land and clearance issues: Nitin Gadkari
content: Union Road Transport and Highways Minister says 489 road projects delayed due to land acquisition, forest clearances, and railway approvals; government working to resolve issues for completion

title: Delhi High Court to examine if Centre has power to order cuts in Udaipur Files movie
content: You have to exercise the powers within the four corners of the statute. You can’t go beyond that, court tells Centre

title: Catholic rites hold united protest against arrest of nuns in BJP-ruled Chhattisgarh
content: Church leaders and laity members from the Syro-Malankara, Syro-Malabar, and Latin rites take out silent march with their mouths gagged to Raj Bhavan, in a reflection of the groundswell of anger and concern over the arrests.

title: A year after Wayanad disaster, carrying capacity of hill stations in Kerala yet to be fixed
content: Kerala High Court last September had directed the State to hold the carrying capacity study of all hill stations

title: Major tax fraud uncovered in Telangana; bogus copper supplies used to claim ₹33.2 crore input credit
content: Preliminary findings suggest that fraudulent invoices worth over ₹100 crore were generated in the scam

title: Arrested Bengaluru woman accused of spreading jihadi content online
content: The accused managed two Facebook pages and an Instagram account, with a combined audience of over 10,000 followers, and sought to provoke communal discord

title: Traffic resumes on Munnar-Devikulam route
content: Public Works department’s National Highway wing on Tuesday completed debris-clearing work on the site at Munnar, where two major landslips occurred recently

title: Chittoor Collector cautions dealers and farmers against hoarding urea stocks
content: Any violation would result in penalties, says Sumit Kumar after observing that farmers were rushing to private fertilizer shops and Rythu Seva Kendras following speculations that urea shortage had set in due to deficit rainfall and prolonged dry weather in June

title: No Ethics, No Respect: Kiren Rijiju Slams Congress After Parliament Walkout
content: The Opposition Congress "ran away" from the Rajya Sabha today because after Prime Minister Narendra Modi's address yesterday, they could not face Home Minister Amit Shah, Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju has said.

title: "Will Take Steps To Secure National Interest": India's 1st Response To US Tariff
content: In its first response after Donald Trump's surprise announcement of a 25% tariff on goods exported to the US from India, plus a 'penalty', the Centre has said it is studying the implications of the move.

title: 3 Terrorists Killed In Op Mahadev Were Shot In Their Heads: Amit Shah
content: Families of Pahalgam attack victims and many other people wanted the three terrorists to be shot in their heads and they met the same fate in Operation Mahadev, Home Minister Amit Shah said in the Rajya Sabha on Wednesday.

title: Volcano Erupts In Russia's Far East After Massive Earthquake
content: Hours After A Major Quake Prompted Evacuations And Tsunami Alerts Across Parts Of The Pacific Coast, Volcano In Russia's Far East Erupted.

title: Trump, In Another Break From The Norm, Interviews 4-Star General Candidates
content: In a break with past practice, President Donald Trump now meets with candidates for promotion to the rank of four-star general, the White House has acknowledged.

title: Tech, Pharma Among 6 Sectors Likely To Be Hit By Trump's 25% Tariffs On India
content: United States President Donald Trump announced 25 percent tariffs on imports from India, a measure which will likely impact some key sectors in India.

title: Pune Porsche Case: Court Denies Temporary Bail Of Juvenile's Father
content: But the prosecution opposed the plea, stating that his mother's ailment was related to age, and there was no immediate danger to her life.

title: "Technical Issue" Briefly Caused Flight Delays: UK Air Traffic Controller
content: A technical issue briefly caused flight delays in Britain on Wednesday before engineers were able to restore the system, the air traffic control operator said.

title: Priyanka Gandhi Urges Centre To Waive Loans Of Wayanad Landslide Victim
content: Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra urged the Centre to waive loans for the flood and landslide victims from her parliamentary constituency of Wayanad, and lamented the "lack" of central assistance in helping the affected people

title: "Give Me Euthanasia": RJD MLA Ritlal Yadav Breaks Down In Patna Court
content: RJD's strongman and sitting MLA from Danapur, Ritlal Yadav, made a sensational appeal in the Patna Civil Court on Wednesday, seeking euthanasia in front of the judge.

title: 'Why Is Trump Troubling India?': Leaders Reacts To US' 25% Tariff Strike
content: The Congress party slammed the BJP government as US President Donald Trump slapped India with 25 per cent tariffs on Wednesday. In a post on X, the Congress party wrote, "country is now bearing the cost of Narendra Modi's 'friendship'".

title: What Industry Leaders Said On Trump's 25% Tariffs, Penalty On India
content: US President Donald Trump announced on Wednesday a 25% tariff on goods imported from India starting August 1 and an unspecified penalty for buying Russian weapons and oil.

title: Chinese Submersible Discovers Deepest-Ever Creatures 10 Km Undersea In Marina Trench
content: A Chinese submersible has discovered thousands of worms and molluscs nearly 10 kilometres (six miles) below sea level in the Mariana Trench, the deepest colony of creatures ever observed, a study revealed on Wednesday.

title: Indian National Jailed In Singapore For Job Scam Using Fake Documents
content: A 20-year-old Indian national has been charged with cheating and using forged documents to deceive a domestic worker into paying over SGD 2,000 for fake job offers for her relatives, The Straits Times reported.

title: Now, 'Dogesh Babu' Applies For ID In Bihar, Case Filed As Per Orders
content: Following the "Dog Babu" incident in Patna where a dog was issued a residential certificate, a similar incident has occurred in Nawada, Bihar.

title: Government Deportations Leave Families Of Bengali Migrants In Deep Distress
content: 60-something Bhodu Sheikh sat on the porch of his ramshackle hut in Dorjee Para, a settlement tucked away in one corner of Paikar village in the Muslim-majority Murarai assembly constituency of West Bengal's Birbhum district, with a blank look in his

title: Full Statement Of Trump's India Tariff, "Penalty" Announcement
content: US President Donald Trump took many by surprise by announcing a 25 per cent tariff on goods exported from India to the United States on Wednesday. Calling India a friend of the United States, Mr Trump also said India would have to pay a penalty.

title: "Congress Gave Away PoK, BJP Will Get It Back": Amit Shah In Rajya Sabha
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah issued a strong response to the Special discussion on Operation Sindoor in Rajya Sabha today -- complete with a message to terrorists, a promise to "get back Pak-Occupied Kashmir" and multiple jibes at the Opposition.

title: UP Man Stabs Wife To Death In Front Of 7-Year-Old Daughter In Tehsil Office
content: A 39-year-old truck driver fatally stabbed his wife in front of their seven-year-old daughter inside a tehsil compound in Sant Kabir Nagar district on Wednesday, police said.

title: Tamil Nadu Dalit Techie Murder: Case Transferred To Crime Branch Amid Outrage
content: The Tamil Nadu police have transferred the case involving the alleged honour killing of Dalit techie Kavin Selvaganesh to the Crime Branch - CID for a "fair and independent investigation".

title: 'Trump frustrated': Is 25% tariff & 'penalty' a bid to pressure India on trade deal?
content: US President Trump, frustrated with stalled trade negotiations with India, has announced a 25% tariff on Indian goods starting August 1st. This decision stems from concerns over India's high tariffs, non-monetary trade barriers, and continued reliance on Russia for energy and military equipment.

title: 'Bharat mata ki jai': India stand firm, refuse to face Pakistan in WCL semifinal
content: The Yuvraj Singh-led India Champions have refused to play Pakistan in the World Championship of Legends semifinals, mirroring their earlier group-stage boycott. This decision, supported by legends like Shikhar Dhawan and Harbhajan Singh, stems from the Pahalgam terror attack. An insider emphasised the team's unwavering commitment to the nation, echoing Dhawan's sentiment that the country comes first.

title: Britain's airspace shut: All outbound UK flights grounded by 'technical issue'
content: A technical issue at the UK's National Air Traffic Services (Nats) caused airspace closure across the country on Wednesday evening. Engineers have successfully restored the affected system, and normal operations are resuming in the London area. Nats is collaborating with airlines and airports to minimize disruption and apologizes for the inconvenience.

title: Astronomer CEO Pete De Joy: To all of our employees at Astronomer; it's time for ...
content: Following a viral video involving its former CEO, Astronomer's current CEO, Pete DeJoy, has lauded his team's resilience. Amidst the controversy, the company hired Gwyneth Paltrow as a temporary spokesperson, releasing a humorous promotional clip. DeJoy expressed gratitude for his employees' dedication and thanked Maximum Effort for their work with Paltrow.

title: It's official! India vs Pakistan WCL semi-final called off; Pak advance to final
content: The highly anticipated semi-final clash between India Champions and Pakistan Champions in the World Championship of Legends has been cancelled. India Champions withdrew from the match, leading to Pakistan Champions advancing directly to the final. Pakistan will now await the winner of the South Africa Champions versus Australia Champions semi-final.

title: 'Insult' vs 'irony': How Op Sindoor debate came to a fiery end
content: The Rajya Sabha saw disruptions during Amit Shah's response on Operation Sindoor. Opposition members demanded Prime Minister Narendra Modi's presence. They protested India's cross-border strikes after the Pahalgam terror attack. Shah mentioned Operation Mahadev, where three terrorists were killed. Opposition MPs staged a walkout, insisting on a response from the Prime Minister. Jairam Ramesh criticized Modi's absence from the debate.

title: Mhatre to lead India U19 in Australia; 14-yr-old Suryavanshi retains spot
content: Ayush Mhatre will captain India U19 in Australia, starting September 21, for a multi-format tour. The squad includes 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi, known for his impressive performances in England. The team will play three Youth ODIs and two multi-day games, carrying forward the core group that excelled in England, where Mhatre and Suryavanshi shone with their batting prowess.

title: Solar Eclipse on Aug 2: The whole 'world to go dark for six minutes'
content: Contrary to viral claims, the world won't experience a six-minute blackout on August 2, 2025. NASA confirms a total solar eclipse will occur on August 2, 2027, darkening parts of Europe, North Africa, and the Middle East.

title: Op Sindoor debate: BJP claims 'Indira Gandhi sought US help to end 1971 war'
content: Bharatiya Janata Party MPs criticized Rahul Gandhi's remarks on Operation Sindoor in Lok Sabha. They alleged Indira Gandhi requested US assistance during the 1971 war with Pakistan. BJP members cited a letter from Indira Gandhi to Richard Nixon. They claimed Congress distorted history and questioned Indira Gandhi's trust in the armed forces.

title: 'Very aggressive with curators': Ex-BCCI umpire recalls Gambhir's previous 'fight'
content: Gautam Gambhir's reported clash with The Oval's curator has stirred memories of a similar incident from 2014, when he argued with a Delhi curator over pitch conditions before a Vijay Hazare Trophy match. Marcus Couto, a former BCCI umpire, recalled Gambhir's aggressive behavior then.

title: Elon Musk corrects 'hiring post' of xAI's Aditya Gupta; says: Starting today...
content: Elon Musk's xAI is doing away with the title "researcher," opting for "engineer" for all technical roles, a decision prompted by Musk's direct intervention on X. This move aims to eliminate what Musk sees as a two-tiered system, aligning xAI with companies like OpenAI and Anthropic that favor unified technical titles.

title: Trump announces 25% tariff on India, 'plus penalty' for buying energy & arms from Russia
content: Donald Trump announced India will face a 25% tariff starting August 1st, along with penalties for energy and arms purchases from Russia. Trump cited high Indian tariffs and trade barriers, as well as continued reliance on Russian resources, as justification. The reciprocal tariffs for other countries will be effective August 1, 2025, according to Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick.

title: Six investors finalise The Hundred deal with ECB; two more to sign up in October
content: The England and Wales Cricket Board has finalised deals with "six strategic partners" for The Hundred, injecting over £500 million into English and Welsh cricket, including £50 million for grassroots development. These partnerships mark a historic moment, making The Hundred the first UK sports competition to secure franchise partnerships of this scale.

title: 'Were you sleeping in history class?' Jaishankar's 'China guru' dig at Rahul
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar strongly criticized Rahul Gandhi in the Rajya Sabha, labeling him a "China-guru" and implying his understanding of China stemmed from Olympic invitations and private lessons from Chinese diplomats. Jaishankar defended his China visit, asserting transparency and contrasting it with alleged secret meetings by others during the 2008 Beijing Olympics.

title: Tom Brady’s letter: Blames football for family rift; takes veiled shot at ex-wife Gisele
content: Tom Brady's recent newsletter delves into his personal life, addressing family, career, and choices. He defends his dedication to football as a form of fatherhood, aiming to set an example for his children through hard work. This message subtly responds to past concerns raised by Gisele Bündchen and the recent Netflix roast, emphasizing that actions reflect priorities.

title: NHL: Nazem Kadri could join Montreal Canadiens; Toronto Maple Leafs move blocked
content: Nazem Kadri might be heading to the Montreal Canadiens as Calgary reportedly refuses trades with Toronto. Friction from Brad Treliving's past dealings with Calgary limits Kadri's options. Montreal, with its young core and skilled system, presents an appealing destination for the veteran center, potentially stabilizing their second line and providing valuable leadership.

title: Linda Hogan’s bold claim: Brooke won’t attend Hulk’s funeral; family rift resurfaces
content: In a shocking turn, Linda Hogan posted a video alleging Brooke Hogan wouldn't attend Hulk Hogan's funeral, citing past trauma and family issues. The wrestling world mourns Hulk Hogan, who passed away on July 24, 2025, from cardiac arrest. However, the video featuring Brooke was later revealed as an AI-generated fake, sparking further controversy.

title: IND vs ENG: Shubman Gill eyes milestone after matching Bradman-Gavaskar feat
content: India skipper Shubman Gill is on the cusp of reaching 6,000 international runs as Team India prepares to face England in the decisive fifth and final Test. Gill has already had a remarkable series, scoring 722 runs with four centuries, equalling records held by legends like Don Bradman and Sunil Gavaskar.

title: 'All that taarif ...': Cong mocks PM Modi after Trump's 25% tariff
content: The Congress party has strongly criticized the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party government. This criticism follows US President Donald Trump's decision to impose a 25% tariff on India. Congress claims India is paying for Prime Minister Narendra Modi's close ties with Trump. They highlighted Modi's support for Trump, yet tariffs were still imposed.

title: Connor McDavid contract update: Hope for Oilers fans amid extension uncertainty
content: Edmonton Oilers fans are anxiously awaiting Connor McDavid's contract extension, as he's eligible to sign since July 1. General Manager Stan Bowman is giving McDavid space but plans to discuss the matter soon. McDavid's decision is crucial for the Oilers' Stanley Cup aspirations and will significantly impact the team's future roster and the NHL landscape.

title: IND vs ENG | 'Don't understand the fuss': Gill breaks silence on Gambhir-curator spat
content: Tensions flared ahead of the crucial fifth Test at The Oval as India captain Shubman Gill addressed a controversy involving head coach Gautam Gambhir and curator Lee Fortis over pitch access. Gill questioned Fortis's conduct and restrictions, while Ben Stokes criticiced the demanding schedule. With England leading the series 2-1, the final Test is poised to be a dramatic conclusion.

title: 'They rained bullets, you served them biryani': Nadda slams Cong in RS
content: JP Nadda criticized the Congress party's handling of past terror attacks. He contrasted the UPA government's response with the current government's actions. Nadda highlighted specific attacks and the perceived lack of action under the previous administration. He praised Prime Minister Modi's strong stance against terrorism. Nadda emphasized the importance of political will in combating terrorism.

title: Nisar mission successful: Nasa-Isro satellite placed in sun-synchronous orbit
content: The Nisar mission’s primary objectives are to study land and ice deformation, land ecosystems and oceanic regions in areas of common interest to the US and Indian science communities.

title: India-UK ink defence pact to develop complex weapons, jet engines
content: India and the United Kingdom have unveiled a 10-year defence roadmap. The focus is on boosting cooperation and strengthening security ties. Both nations will work on co-development and joint research. They will also focus on innovation across defence technologies. Maritime security and military ties will also be strengthened. The roadmap aims for regional stability and a rules-based international order.

title: Watch: Patients wade through ankle-deep water as rain floods Delhi’s Safdarjung Hospital
content: Torrential rains paralyzed Delhi, causing severe waterlogging at Safdarjung Hospital, where patients waded through flooded wards. In a tragic incident, a woman and her son, new to the city for work, died when a weakened boundary wall collapsed on their shelter in Sehgal Colony. Residents claim construction and tree cutting contributed to the wall's instability, leading to the fatal collapse.

title: Friendship Day: Wishes, messages, quotes, captions, to make your buddy feel special
content: International Friendship Day, established by the UN in 2011 and observed on July 30th, celebrates the cherished bonds of friendship. It's an opportunity to express gratitude and acknowledge the value friends bring to our lives. The day is marked by sharing heartfelt wishes, quotes, and messages that highlight the importance of loyalty, support, and shared memories.

title: Jasprit Bumrah IN or OUT? Shubman Gill gives crucial update
content: Will Jasprit Bumrah play in the crucial fifth Test against England at The Oval? Skipper Shubman Gill remained tight-lipped, citing a green wicket as a factor. Bumrah's form dipped in the drawn Manchester Test, with his pace noticeably reduced. Despite this, he remains a key bowler, tied with Siraj for most wickets.

title: 'Some people uncomfortable with history': Jaishankar slams Cong in RS over IWT
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar addressed the Rajya Sabha on Operation Sindoor, following the Pahalgam terror attack. He affirmed the government's firm stance against terrorism, highlighting diplomatic actions, including potentially suspending the Indus Waters Treaty. Jaishankar refuted claims of US mediation for a ceasefire between India and Pakistan.

title: IND vs ENG | 'Uneven gaps': Stokes slams scheduling after injury rules him out
content: Ben Stokes' shoulder injury sidelines him for the final Test against India, prompting him to criticise the series' demanding schedule and inconsistent gaps between matches. Stokes emphasised the physical and mental toll on both teams. He addressed the handshake controversy and praised the series' competitive spirit, while also commenting on the Oval's seam-friendly pitch.

title: IND vs ENG: Stokes out! England make big changes to playing XI
content: Ben Stokes' shoulder injury forces him to miss the final Test against India, leading to four changes in England's playing XI. Ollie Pope will take over the captaincy, while Ollie Pope will be the stand-in captain. Jacob Bethell, Gus Atkinson, Jamie Overton, and Josh Tongue are included, aiming to bolster the team's performance at The Oval.

title: Tsunami disrupts marine life: Hundreds of sea lions flee powerful waves – Watch
content: A powerful 8.8-magnitude earthquake off Russia's Kamchatka Peninsula triggered tsunami warnings across the Pacific, sending Steller sea lions fleeing to higher ground as waves crashed into the coast. While waves reached up to 4 meters in Kamchatka and impacted Japan, Alaska, and the US West Coast, little major damage was reported, though some injuries and flooding occurred.

title: 'Joyous day': PM hails return of Buddha's relics; back in India after 127 yrs
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced the return of the sacred Piprahwa relics of Lord Buddha to India after 127 years. Discovered in 1898, the relics were taken abroad during the colonial period. The government intervened after the relics appeared in an international auction, emphasizing India's dedication to preserving its cultural heritage and its deep connection to Buddhism.

title: Bumrah OUT, Kuldeep and Arshdeep IN: India's predicted playing XI vs England
content: India and England will play the series-deciding final Test at the Kennington Oval. England leads the series 2-1. India aims to level the series. Dhruv Jurel will replace the injured Rishabh Pant. Ben Stokes is out due to injury. Ollie Pope will captain England. England has made four changes to their team.

title: IND vs ENG: Ben Stokes breaks silence on handshake row: 'Let’s not focus...'
content: England captain Ben Stokes addressed the controversy surrounding his handshake offer to Indian batsmen Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar during the drawn Old Trafford Test. Stokes, who will miss the final Test due to injury, defended his offer, stating he didn't want to bowl his main bowlers.

title: Jake Paul’s MVP makes massive women’s boxing contracts with Shannon Courtenay & others
content: Most Valuable Promotions (MVP), led by Jake Paul, has signed five prominent female boxers, including four world champions, on July 29, 2025. The new signees are Shannon Courtenay, Jasmine Artiga, Desley Robinson, Yesica Nery Plata, and Sa’Rai Brown‑El. This strategic move aims to globally expand women's boxing, adding to MVP's already impressive roster of female fighters.

title: On Day 1 of posting, UP SDM does sit-ups in front of advocates over tehsil filth
content: IAS officer Rinku Singh Rahi, newly appointed SDM, took a unique approach to address cleanliness issues in Puwaiyan tehsil. Confronted by striking advocates about the dirty premises, Rahi acknowledged the problem and performed sit-ups as a form of accepting responsibility. He had previously made offenders and parents of truant children do sit-ups to deter undesirable behavior.

title: ‘Saiyaara’ box office collection: Mohit Suri's movie inches towards Rs 270 crore mark
content: ‘Saiyaara’, starring Aneet Padda and Ahaan Panday, continues its box office domination, surpassing collections of films like ‘Sikandar’ and ‘Housefull 5’. Despite facing competition from ‘Mahavtar Narsimha’, the film earned ₹9.25 crore on its second Monday and showed slight growth on Tuesday. With a total collection of ₹270 crore

title: Slapped for ‘insulting’ Dimple Yadav: Maulana assaulted after TV debate
content: Maulana Sajid Rashidi was allegedly assaulted in Noida by individuals claiming affiliation with the Samajwadi Party, following a news debate. The altercation stemmed from Rashidi's purported derogatory remarks against MP Dimple Yadav. Kuldeep Bhati, identifying himself as a Samajwadi Party member, posted a video online claiming responsibility.

title: ITR-3 enabled for e-filing: Key things to know before filing for AY 2025–26
content: The Income Tax Department has facilitated online ITR-3 filing for AY 2025-26, benefiting individuals with income from share trading, business ventures, and unlisted shares. Key updates include mandatory Form 10-IEA selection, revised capital gains reporting, and higher asset/liability reporting thresholds. Filers must also provide detailed disclosures on TDS sections and deductions.

title: Gran Turismo 7 update adds one of the rarest cars on Earth
content: new 1.61 update allows car enthusiasts to mark another dream drive off their checklist . players can take it for as many spins as they want in the racing sim . three brand-new race events are available in the World Circuits section of the game .

title: Why Ichiro, CC Sabathia and Billy Wagner are Hall of Famers
content: Ichiro Suzuki, CC Sabathia and Billy Wagner are inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame . the trio stands out for their disparate backgrounds . they were a star in the Japan Pacific League at 20 years old before becoming the first Japanese position player .

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United target Pope, Donnarumma in goalkeeper search
content: Beth Lindop believes that Liverpool should prioritise signing a centre-back amid links to striker Alexander Isak . the 33-year-old is a short-term option for the club as they look set to bring in a stopper . talksSPORT claims that Pope, 33, is an option .

title: They (finally) meet again: Three keys to Liberty-Lynx WNBA Finals rematch
content: the new york Liberty won the franchise's first WNBA title this past October . the Liberty defeated the Minnesota Lynx 67-62 in overtime . they have yet to play this season in a second consecutive commissioner's cup final .

title: Bengals release veteran RB Moss after 1 season
content: Stephen A. breaks down why the Bengals missing the playoffs is a problem with the organization, not Joe Burrow. (1:03) CINCINNATI -- The  Cincinnati Bengals  released RB  Zack Moss  on Wednesday, the team announced. Moss, 27, started training camp on the non-football injury list after suffering a season-ending neck injury last season. In 2024, Moss signed a two-year deal with the Bengals worth $8 million. After last season, Moss and Cincinnati agreed to a restructured deal worth $1.7 million in 2025. Wednesday's release will cost the Bengals $1.88 million in dead money against the salary cap and net Cincinnati $1.2 million in cap savings. In eight games last season, Moss rushed for 242 yards and two touchdowns while splitting reps with  Chase Brown . This offseason, Cincinnati signed running back  Samaje Perine  and drafted former Texas Tech tailback  Tahj Brooks  in the sixth round.

title: Liverpool won the Premier League and now they're on a spending spree. Why?
content: a year ago, no one was excited about the club and the fan base was ready to panic . the reds were coming off a bounce-back season where they were top of the table in April . a slew of injuries pulled them back into third place, behind arsenal and manchester city .
